definition: to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert a danger (esp. political or medical)
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
surname Wei
danger/to endanger/Taiwan pr. [wei2]
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
surname An
content/calm/still/quiet/safe/secure/in good health/to find a place for/to install/to fix/to fit/to bring (a charge against sb)/to pacify/to harbor (good intentions)/security/safety/peace/ampere

sentences.english: There may be no turning back for life-limiting illnesses.
sentences.chinese: 生命垂危的重病有可能不能转危为安了。

sentences.english: Yong-shou Chen in Li Zhixun desperate rescue finally turned the corner.
sentences.chinese: 陈永寿在李致勋不顾一切的抢救下终于转危为安。

sentences.english: United fans have come to take for granted that van der Sar will save the day.
sentences.chinese: 曼联球迷都想当然地认为范德萨能够转危为安。

sentences.english: Her illness was serious but the doctors managed to bring her through.
sentences.chinese: 她病情严重，医生好不容易使她转危为安。

definition: to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert disaster
out of danger/to avoid danger
to escape (danger)/to rescue/to come out alive
in imminent peril (idiom)/on the brink of crisis
to rescue/to be rescued
to rescue
to be more scared than hurt (idiom)/to get through a daunting experience without mishap
mortal danger, escape alive (idiom); a narrow escape/to survive by the skin of one's teeth
to provide critical care (to a patient or a diseased plant)
to send or deliver to the hospital
to be critically ill/to be terminally ill
to just escape from calamity
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); snatching victory from the jaws of defeat
close to death/life-threatening (illness)
safe and sound (idiom)
to come back from death's door (idiom); unexpected rescue from danger/fig. to recover from a seemingly impossible situation/to find a way out of a predicament
